groups.name: Things You Wear on Your Head

easy.notes: Categories: Things with Wings (bird types), Headwear, Objects You Can Lift (common items), and 3-sided shapes. Near-miss temptation: 'cone' could be a 3D shape or an ice cream; it's clearly a shape here, not a food item.

medium.notes: Prefix group: look for the shared 'un-' prefix; Compound parts: two-word items where each part is a standalone word. Move-in-pairs: items commonly found as pairs. Colors named by objects: color words that come from everyday items (orange, lime from fruits/foods). Near-miss temptation: 'peach' could be a fruit or a color; here it is a color name derived from the fruit, which could confuse but is acceptable as color name.

hard.notes: Invisible Helpers: things that represent something non-physical like sound or memory. Named After Living Things: obvious ones; include one near-miss with 'otterfly' (not a real word) to test the solverâ€”it's there to be a tempting but incorrect option. Tools with Special Roles: common measurement or construction tools; Weather Signals: forms of weather. Near-miss temptation: 'otter' and 'ant' are real, but 'otterfly' is not a real item; avoid selecting it as valid.
